message: Week 7 Learning Outcomes identified: (1) Attributions (Naive scientist, Correspondence inference, Covariation theory), (2) Conformity and Group Influence (Internalization vs Compliance, Sherif's/Asch's studies), (3) Obedience (Milgram's experiment, Zimbardo's experiment)

Week 8 Learning Outcomes identified: (1) Early experiences and attachment (Harlow, Bowlby, Ainsworth), (2) Development of self-concept (Gallup's mirror test), (3) Cognitive development and Piaget's Theory (4 stages), (4) Zone of Proximal Development - Vygotsky

WEEK 7 SOCIAL PSYCHOLOGY - Key Concepts (15+ items): (1) Internal vs External attribution, (2) Heider's Naive Scientist Theory, (3) Correspondence Inference Theory (Jones & Davis), (4) Covariation Theory (Kelley) with Consensus/Distinctiveness/Consistency, (5) Fundamental Attribution Error (Ross), (6) False Consensus Effect, (7) Self-Serving Bias, (8) Actor-Observer Effect, (9) Conformity (Internalization vs Compliance), (10) Sherif's Autokinetic Effect Study, (11) Asch's Line Studies, (12) Informational vs Normative Social Influence, (13) Milgram's Obedience Experiment (65% to 450V), (14) Hofling et al. Nurse Study, (15) Zimbardo's Stanford Prison Experiment

key_statistics: 65% went to maximum voltage in Milgram

message: WEEK 8 DEVELOPMENTAL PSYCHOLOGY - Key Concepts (12+ items): (1) Attachment definition (Kagan et al.), (2) Harlow's monkey experiments (cloth vs wire mother), (3) Bowlby's Attachment Theory (innate biological system, secure base, critical period 0-3 years), (4) Ainsworth's Strange Situation, (5) 4 attachment styles (Secure 65%, Avoidant 20%, Resistant 10-15%, Disorganized 5-10%), (6) Czech Twins case study (recovery from deprivation), (7) Romanian orphanages (sensitive period ~6-24 months), (8) Self-concept components (self-image, self-esteem, ideal-self), (9) Gallup's mirror test / Rouge test (self-recognition 15-24 months), (10) Piaget's 4 stages (Sensorimotor, Pre-operational, Concrete operational, Formal operational), (11) Assimilation vs Accommodation, (12) Vygotsky's ZPD and scaffolding

key_statistics: Sensitive period 6-24 months for deprivation effects

message: Important examples for quiz generation identified: WEEK 7 - (a) Sarah fails PSYC100 exam (Covariation theory example), (b) Quiz game study (Fundamental Attribution Error), (c) Castro study (FAE even with coin flip), (d) Sign-wearing experiment (False Consensus), (e) "I got 90!" vs "Lecturer gave me 40!" (Self-Serving Bias). WEEK 8 - (a) Cloth vs wire mother (Harlow), (b) Strange Situation 8 steps, (c) Water conservation task (Pre-operational stage), (d) Three mountains task (Egocentrism), (e) Rouge test timing (15-24 months)
